intro: Peucedanum upingtoniae, commonly known as the Upington's angelica, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is found in specific regions of the Western Cape. It is notable for its ornamental value and has been the subject of conservation efforts due to its limited distribution.
